question: An existing system that is not in strict compliance with the provisions of this code shall be permitted to be continued in use as long as the _______ has determined that such use does not constitute a distinct hazard to life.

Cylinder and cryogenic liquid container outlet connections shall be affixed in such a manner as to be intregal to the valve, unremovable with ordinary tools or so designed as to render the attachment point ________ when removal of the outlet connection is attempted.
Which of the following systems shall not be permitted to be located in an outdoor enclosure?
What is required of the alarm system if another alarm condition occurs while the audible alarm is manually silenced?
options: Nothing, the visual indicator is still active

question: Cylinders in use and in storage shall be prevented from reaching temperatures in excess of ____________.
Locations for central supply systems shall have electrical devices protected from ___________.
Mechanical exhaust for central supply locations shall not be more than ____.
For purposes of this code, an oxygen enriched atmosphere is an atmosphere where to total concentration of oxygen exceeds _______ by volume.
Final line pressure regulators, when used for bulk cryogenic liquid systems shall be of a ________ design.
The pressure in the main line of each medical gas system, the operation and condition of the source of supply and the reserve source (if any) shall be monitored at the _______ alarm
The instrument air dew point high alarm from each compressor site will indicate at the master alarm panels when the line pressure dew point is greater than _______.
Brazed joints shall be made using a brazing alloy that exhibits a melting temperature in excess of _________ to retain the integrity of the piping system in the event of fire.
Manifolds for gas cylinders shall consist of ______ equal headers; each with one average day’s supply, but not fewer than _______ connections.
Manifolds for gas cylinders shall actuate a(n) ___________ signal and shall activate an indicator at all _______ alarm panels to indicate when or just before changeover from one header to the other.
In a medical gas system with emergency reserve, which alarm system(s) will activate when, or just before, the changeover to the reserve supply occurs?
The gas produced by evaporation from the secondary header in a cryogenic liquid container system shall enter the supply system __________ of the final line regulator.
A facility is in the planning stages of installing an emergency oxygen supply connection (EOSC). How many feet is the minimum clearance around this connection ?
options: clearance must be 1.5x the width of the auxiliary source for service to the system

question: A(n) ___________ can be used as a substitute for the EOSC at a category 1 facility.
Final line pressure controls shall be sized to ___ of the peak calculated demand.
Bulk cryogenic liquid systems shall be installed in accordance with ______.
Central supply systems for nitrous oxide and carbon dioxide using cylinders or portable containers shall be prevented from reaching temperatures lower than ___°F.
Installers of Category 1 medical gas piping systems must be qualified to ASSE 6010. What is the certification requirement for installers of a Category 3 system?
When is the initial pressure test conducted by the installer?
options: after installation of the alarm sensors
before blowdown of the distribution piping
after blowdown of the distribution piping
before installation of station rough-in assemblies
answer: after blowdown of the distribution piping

question: The master alarm system shall activate when the pressure in the main supply lines increase or decrease by __________ percent.
When designing and constructing central supply systems, the storage shall __________.
options: have a minimum of two entry/exits if outdoors
have a minimum 1-hour fire resistance rating

question: The medical air dew point high alarm from each compressor site will indicate at the master alarm panels when the line pressure dew point is greater than ____________.
Which source shall NOT be used to power the venturri of a WAGD system?
For medical-surgical vacuum systems, piping shall be hard-drawn, seamless copper tube type _________.
Which type of connectors shall connect the medical air compressors with their intake and outlet piping?
Medical air filters shall be sized for 100% of the system peak calculated demand and be rated for a minimum of ______ efficiency at _______ micron or greater.
Where compressors that separate the oil containing section from the compression chamber are used, each compressor shall be monitored for which of the following?
Joints shall be brazed within _______ hours after the surfaces are cleaned for brazing.
Medical air compressor systems shall have a pressure relief valve set at ______percent above line pressure.
Underground piping buried outside of buildings shall be installed below the local level of frost penetration and shall be protected by a(n) _____________.
What is the standard gauge pressure (psi) for nitrogen gas service?
Receivers for medical air shall be equipped with _____________.
A wireless communication device is employed in a medical gas or vacuum warning system. Which type of supervision is required for this device?
options: A visual indicator shall be located in the maintenance/engineering department.
The device shall be installed at the medical gas or vacuum source
The device shall be located at a nurse’s station
It will be supervised such that failure of communication shall initiate an alarm.
answer: It will be supervised such that failure of communication shall initiate an alarm.

question: How many hours must the medical air compressor system be operating normally before air quality test can be performed?
Where medical gas systems operate at pressures other that the standard gauge pressures, which of these is required to be listed on the station outlet identification?
options: Gas registration number and a toll-free number to call for information

question: Brazing procedures and brazer performance for the installation of medical gas and vacuum piping shall be qualified in accordance with _______________.
In a non-anesthetizing area, on which side of a zone valve shall the area alarm pressure/vacuum sensor be located?
options: NFPA 99 does not specify a requirement

question: Medical air compressor air intake shall be located outdoors a minimum distance of ________ above the ground level.
Which of the following conditions must be met where medical gas and vacuum systems are installed by non-certified personnel?
options: An installer certified to ASSE 6010 must be present to oversee the installation
An ASSE 6020 inspector is present on the job sit to inspect the installation
The installer must be an employee of an authorized Medical Gas contractor
Installation by anyone other than 6010 certified personnel is NOT permitted
answer: Installation by anyone other than 6010 certified personnel is NOT permitted

question: Central supply systems for medical vacuum shall be equipped with filtration sized for _________ of peak calculated demand while one is isolated.
Wooden rack for cylinder storage may be permitted under which conditions?
options: They are permitted with NO set conditions
They must be located in an area with a fire suppression system
Wooden racks are no longer permitted
answer: Wooden racks are no longer permitted

question: NFPA 99 specifies that the medical gas piping system shall be protected against all EXCEPT which of the following?
What percent of the zones shall be tested at the outlet most remote from the source to verify the piping particulate test?
Which of these is an NFPA 99 requirement for the labeling of pipes in a medical gas system?
options: Label shall wrap completely around the pipe

question: A tool is allowed to be used by the installer to mechanically limit the makeup depth of the fitting to be brazed. Under what conditions is this method permitted for the installation of medical gas piping?
options: Only where BCuP 5 brazing rod is used
Where limited depth is not less than the minimum cup depth per ANSI/ASME
answer: Where limited depth is not less than the minimum cup depth per ANSI/ASME

question: Liquid ring compressors, service water and seal water shall be treated to control_________.
Liquid ring compressor system shall have a reserve medical air standby header (1HR) or a____________ as backup.
The medical air intake shall be located a minimum of _____ from all vehicular exhausts and noxious fumes.
The medical air intake shall be located a minimum of _____ from all doors, windows or other openings in the building.

In a facility where medical gas or vacuum systems are present and the failure of such equipment or system is likely to cause imminent major injury or death to patients or caregivers, the system shall be designed to meet which Category of requirements?
Category 1 medical-surgical vacuum sources shall, at a minimum, consist of ____________ or more vacuum pumps.
Who shall be responsible for developing an emergency plan in the event of medical air loss at a Category 2 facility?
Piping between the vacuum pump and the source shutoff valve shall be permitted to be _______.
Computer systems used as a master alarm shall be continuously attended or shall provide remote signaling of responsible parties through _________.

ASSE 6000 Annex J provides “Recommended Guidelines for Conducting Planned Medical Gas Systems Shutdown and Temporary Backfeed”.  Annex J guidelines do NOT include a list of responsibilities for which types of worker?
An assembly of equipment that holds a capacity of oxygen greater than _____________is defined as a Bulk Oxygen System.
The medical-surgical vacuum exhaust shall be turned down and screened. The screening shall be fabricated using what type of material?
Compressed gas cylinders must meet which of the following criteria in order to be acceptable for use in an acute health care facility?
options: Be appropriately color coded in accordance with U.S.D.A. requirements
Be appropriately identified by labels or stencils in accordance with CGA C-7 criteria
Be constructed in accordance with specifications and regulations of OSHA
answer: Be appropriately identified by labels or stencils in accordance with CGA C-7 criteria

question: Who shall witness the installer perform the standing pressure test?
options: The authority having jurisdiction or its designee

question: A patient care space is any space of a health care facility wherein patients are intended to be __________.
Stainless tube may be joined by any methods EXCEPT which of the following?
Excluding outdoor locations, which of these is an NFPA 99 requirement for the wiring of each of the two mandatory master alarms?
options: Alarms shall be sent to the area alarm panel in the emergency room
Wired independently to the initiating device(s) for each signal
answer: Wired independently to the initiating device(s) for each signal

question: Which of the following is true of Category 1 support gases?
options: Permitted to power medical – surgical tools
Subject to greater hazards than present in other piped gases

question: WAGD networks shall provide a WAGD inlet in all locations where __________ is intended to be administered.

If a nonmetallic flexible connector is being used in a Category 1 health care facility to connect the manifold to the gas distribution piping, what is the maximum length (feet) permitted for the flexible connector?
options: They shall be no longer than necessary
The use of flexible connectors is not permitted
answer: They shall be no longer than necessary

question: Inspection and testing shall be performed on all new piped gas systems, additions, renovations, temporary installations or repaired systems to assure the facility that all applicable provisions of NFPA 99C have been adhered to and system integrity has been achieved or maintained. What is required of the individual doing the testing or inspecting?

Liquid containers shall have additional product identification (such as a 360 degree wrap-a-round tape for medical liquid containers) visible from all directions with a minimum of ________high letters.
Vacuum piping for ____________ shall be connected separately from the medical surgical system directly to the receiver tank through its own isolation valve and fluid trap located at the receiver.
The vacuum exhaust shall not discharge ______________.
options: in a place of public assembly
at a different level from air intakes
answer: in a place of public assembly

question: Which of these operations would NOT breach the vacuum system?
options: Replacement of system component with an identical one
Testing a system component with a leak detecting solution
answer: Testing a system component with a leak detecting solution

question: Which is a permitted use of the medical-surgical vacuum system?
Which of the following is an instrument air quality requirement?
options: It shall be filtered to .7 micron
It shall be dry to a dew point of -30oF
It shall be compliant with instrument Air section in ANSI/ISA S-7.0.01
It shall be compliant with medical air USP
answer: It shall be compliant with instrument Air section in ANSI/ISA S-7.0.01

question: The standing pressure test for positive pressure medical gas piping shall be conducted with the source valve closed and the piping system subjected to which test time and pressure?
options: 24 hours at 20% above normal operating pressure
answer: 24 hours at 20% above normal operating pressure

question: Instrument air systems shall be permitted to interconnect with the medical air system provided the system has __________.
options: at least two or more compressors
separate source valves for each system

question: A standard gauge pressure of 160-185 psi applies to which of the following?
All fittings for medical gas work shall be kept separate from other tools, and kept free of grease or oil. If cleaned, only a degreaser such as ____________ is permitted.
To prevent damage when testing outlets/inlets, you must use which of these components?
options: Gas-specific adapters as described by the manufacturer
answer: Gas-specific adapters as described by the manufacturer

question: Final line filters for instrument air shall be rated for a minimum of ____ percent efficiency at ____ micron.
A signal from each _______ system shall be connected to the master alarm panels to indicate that a problem is present with the source equipment.
Station outlets/inlets shall be identified as to the  _________ for the specific gas or vacuum provided.
Final line filters for instrument air shall be equipped with a _______ visual indicator showing the status of the filter element life.
Which of these is a requirement for area alarm panels?
options: Located at a nurses station and in the engineering department

question: A valve installed in each medical gas and vacuum piping system shall be tested to verify which of the following?
options: Proper operation and rooms or areas of control
answer: Proper operation and rooms or areas of control

question: Manifolds for gas cylinders shall actuate a(an) _______ signal and shall activate an indicator at all _______ alarm panels to indicate when or just before changeover from one header to the other.
All valves except zone valve box assemblies shall be __________.
options: locked or latched in the operating position
labeled indicating contents and location served

question: With the approval of the authority having jurisdiction, in what areas shall the shutoff valves be permitted to be secured to prevent inappropriate access?
New or replacement shutoff valves for medical gas pressure piping systems shall ______________.
options: be of brass or bronze construction

question: The reserve header in a cryogenic liquid cylinder manifold system shall have sufficient cylinder connections for an average day’s supply, but NOT fewer than how many connections?
In central supply systems using gas cylinders, each header shall have a ________ valve to prevent backflow and to permit service to the header.
Those sections or portions of the piping system that serve a room or group of rooms on the same story of the facility.  This is the definition of which of the following?
The vertical pipes connecting the system main line(s) with the branch lines on the various levels of the facility.  This is the definition of which of the following?
Only one service valve is required for each branch off the riser, unless the number of zone valves on that branch exceeds ______ valves.
What valves shall be readily operable from a standing position in the corridor on the same floor they serve?
Immediately outside each Category 1 space and anesthetizing location, there shall be located a(n)_____________ for each medical gas, vacuum and WAGD system.
The final connection between new piping and an existing system may be tested with the system gas and must be checked with a leak detectant that does NOT contain which of these agents?
While brazing medical-gas copper joints, a purge gas shall flow continuously to prevent the formation of copper oxide on the inside surface of the joint. What shall be used as a purge gas?
Pipe labels shall be located at a maximum interval of how many feet?
Audible and visual alarm indicators shall meet which of the following requirements?
options: Individual indicators shall NOT be less than DN20 size
Testing to determine indicator function should be scheduled periodically and records maintained between testing.
The staff should be trained to operate the test button periodically and report malfunctions.
answer: Testing to determine indicator function should be scheduled periodically and records maintained between testing.

question: Station outlets that operate at pressures other than standard gauge pressure (50-55 psi or 160-185 psi for nitrogen), what is required of the outlet labeling?
options: be located away from other outlets
include the operating pressure along with the name of the gas
answer: include the operating pressure along with the name of the gas

question: In compliance with NFPA 70, the new alarm wiring is being run installed underground from the initiating device at the source to a junction box located where the wiring first enters the building.  NFPA 99 permits what minimum number of sets of wires to connect the initiating device with the junction box for each signal?
Which of the following filler metals shall be used to braze copper-to-copper joints in medical gas/vacuum distribution piping?

NFPA 99 requires tubing to be cut square using a sharp tubing cutter that shall be free from grease, oil or other lubricants not suitable for oxygen service. What sort of treatment is permitted of the tube ends before brazing?
options: May be deburred or rolled smooth
answer: May be deburred or rolled smooth

question: To assure that all ambient air has been removed from the pipeline prior to brazing, a/an ______ shall be used to verify the effectiveness of the nitrogen purge.
Factory installed tubes on station inlets shall be NOT less than ________ with 0.4 inch minimum inside diameter.
The minimum backfilled cover for buried piping shall be 36 in., except that a minimum cover shall be reduced to ___________ where physical damage is otherwise prevented.
The installation of medical gas and vacuum systems shall be made by experienced, qualified and competent installers. The installers shall meet the requirements of ___________.
After completion of all installer-performed tests which of the following methods shall be used to determine that no cross-connection exists?
In an Emergency Oxygen Supply Connection the check valves are required to be constructed of which of the following materials?
options: Materials per the EOSC manufacturer’s recommendations
NFPA 99 does NOT establish any material requirements for these check valves

question: Which of these is a requirement for each station inlet?
Medical gas central supply systems are NOT permitted to be located where?
options: In the same storage facility as medical gas cylinders
Remote from the medical gas system use points

question: Fittings, valves, and other components for oxygen use in a Category 1 distribution system shall be ___________ until prepared for installation.
options: Delivered sealed, labeled, and kept sealed
Kept at a minimum inventory level
Plugged or capped by the manufacturer
Stored in a locked room or secure facility
answer: Delivered sealed, labeled, and kept sealed

question: The purpose of the NFPA 99 Code is to provide minimum requirements for the  ________ for facilities, material, equipment, and appliances, including other hazards associated with the primary hazards.
The scale range of positive pressure analog indicators shall have the normal reading fall within the _________ percentage of the gauge scale.
What does it mean when equipment, material, or services are shown as “listed”?
options: They are identified and published by an organization that is acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction.
They have been found tolerable for the purpose described in the manufacturer’s specifications.
They have been tested and approved by the construction supervisor
They have been tested by a medical gas verifier
answer: They are identified and published by an organization that is acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction.

question: To facilitate service, testing or replacement, all pressure switches and mainline gauges downstream of the source valve shall be provided with a ________________.
Manufactured assemblies employing flexible hose shall not be labeled with ______.
The accuracy of digital indicators shall be +/- ____ % of the operating pressure at which they are used.
A medical gas master or area alarm panel should be set to actuate a(an) __________ indicator when the communication with an alarm-initiating device is disconnected.
Area alarms shall monitor _________ in the area served.
options: high pressure in positive pressure medical gas lines
low pressure in positive pressure medical gas lines
low vacuum pressure in medical-surgical vacuum lines

question: Communication devices that do not use electrical wiring for signal transmission can use _____.
Fittings for positive pressure medical gas systems shall be cleaned for oxygen service by _________ in accordance with CGA G-4.1.
options: a third party agency other than the manufacturer

question: It is the responsibility of the _____ to furnish documentation certifying that all installed piping materials are cleaned for oxygen service.
A low-pressure, vacuum-insulated vessel containing gases in liquid form. This is an NFPA 99 definition for which of the following.
Which of the following fittings is NOT permitted for joining vacuum distribution pipeline systems?
Copper tube hangers for medical gas and vacuum distribution piping shall be ________.
options: plastic coated in potentially damp locations

question: Where existing, the portion of the supply equipment that automatically supplies the system when the primary and secondary are unable.
A chemical element that, at normal atmospheric temperatures and pressures, exists as a colorless, odorless and tasteless gas and comprises about 21% of the earth’s atmosphere by volume.
A method used to provide a source of drainage, aspiration and suction in order to remove bodily fluids from patients.
Heating, cooling, ventilating and process systems serving spaces or providing healthcare functions shall be provided in accordance with ______.
A ______ is an extensive compilation of provisions covering broad subject matter or that is suitable for adoption into law independently.
Metallic flexible joints are being used in the pipeline for vibration control.  Which of the following is NOT required of such joints?
options: Received on the jobsite with certification of cleanliness
Suitable for service at 150 psig or above
answer: Suitable for service at 150 psig or above

question: Performance qualification of brazers shall remain in effect indefinitely unless the brazer does NOT braze with the qualified procedure for longer than what period of time?
Mock Exam Diagram 1.pdfRefer to Drawing #1. Area 2 would be classified as a _________.
Mock Exam Diagram 1.pdfRefer to Drawing #1. Valve #1 is a _______.
Mock Exam Diagram 1.pdfRefer to Drawing #1. Valve #7 is the _________ where the main line enters the building.
Mock Exam Diagram 1.pdfRefer to Drawing #1. Valves #5, 6 & 13 are _______.
Mock Exam Diagram 1.pdfRefer to Drawing #1. The sensor indicated at #8 is the ______.
Mock Exam Diagram 1.pdfRefer to Drawing #1. Items 2 and 12 would be best described as ________.
Mock Exam Diagram 1.pdfRefer to Drawing #1. Item #10 is a ______ valve.
The appropriate adapter shall be obtained from the facility or manufacturer, and high purge rates of at least 225 Nl/min (_____ SCFM) shall be put on each outlet.
The moisture concentration of the outlet test shall not exceed ____ ppm or an equivalent pressure dew point of -12°C (10°F) at a gauge pressure of 345 kPa (50 psi).
The filter shall accrue no more than 0.001 g (_____ mg) of matter from any outlet tested.
A minimum of 1000 L (35 ft3) of gas shall be filtered through a clean, white _____ micron filter at a minimum flow rate of 100 Nl/min (3.5 SCFM).
Oxygen and medical air outlets serving Category 1 space shall allow a transient flow rate of 170 SLPM (____ SCFM) for 3 seconds.
Medical–surgical vacuum inlets shall draw 85 Nl/min (_____ SCFM) without reducing the vacuum pressure below 300 mm (12 in.) gauge HgV at any adjacent station inlet.
A bulk nitrous oxide system has a storage capacity of more than _____ pounds of nitrous oxide
A chemical process of oxidation that occurs at a rate fast enough to produce heat and usually light in the form of either a glow or flame.What is this the definition of?
A low-pressure, vacuum-insulated vessel containing gases in liquid form.What is the definition for?
A valve, usually a needle valve, that precisely controls flow of gas.What is the definition for?
According to Annex D in the ASSE 6000 sufficient spare parts should be maintained to ___ parts
options: Alow for a one month supply
Allow for a one year supply
There is no requirement to maintain spare parts

question: According to the ASSE 6000, Which is likely to clogg vacuum piping?

An assembly of equipment for supplying compressed gas (consisting of, but not limited to, storage containers, pressure regulators, pressure relief devices, vaporizers, manifolds, and interconnecting piping) that terminates where the gas, at service pressure, first enters the main line. The storage containers are either stationary or movable and include unconnected reserves on hand at the site, and the source gas is stored as a compressed gas or cryogenic fluid.What type of system is this?
Category 1 facility, testing and calibration procedures shall be established to ensure carbon monoxide monitors are calibrated _____
options: Annually or more often, if recommended by the manufacturer
As directed by the administrator of the facility
By an independent calibration/ testing company
answer: Annually or more often, if recommended by the manufacturer

question: Equipment, materials, or services included in a list published by an organization that is acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction and concerned with evaluation of products or services, that maintains periodic inspection of production of listed equipment or materials or periodic evaluation of services, and whose listing states that either the equipment, material, or service meets appropriate designated standards or has been tested and found suitable for a specified purpose.

Exists at cryogenic temperature, approximately −184.4°C (−300°F) at atmospheric pressure. It retains all of the properties of gaseous oxygen, but, in addition, when allowed to warm to room temperature at atmospheric pressure, it will evaporate and expand to fill a volume _____ times its liquid volume.
Medical gas system maintenance person shall be required to demonstrate a basic working knowledge of all _____ listed in ASSE standard 6001, as used in the NFPA 99.
Medical gas systems maintenance personnel shall be able to describe the precautions and hazards during maintenance and testing related to____?
NFPA 99 code, states medical air may be supplied from except which of the following?
options: Reconstituted from oxygen USP and oil-free, dry nitrogen NF

question: NFPA 99 requires station outlet/inlet to be identified as to the _____ for the specific gas or vacuum provided.
Piping systems for patient gas/vacuum shall ___ used for distribution of flammable anesthetic gases.
Regular preventive maintenance shall be scheduled to check the vacuum pressure performanceof each medical-surgical vacuum station inlet. This schedule shall be as determined by the ____ ?
Service manuals, procedures and instructions provided by the _____ shall be used in the maintenance of equipment
Source equipment serving vacuum systems shall be labeled or tagged to identify the vacuum system and also include
options: medical gas or support gas color code

question: Spare parts shall be maintained for all except which of the following?
The cutting and brazing of medical gas piping shalle be preformed by what medical gas credential?
Vacuum systems deemed breached shall be subject to inspection and testing to the specific area located _____ of the point of intrusion.
What is the permitted use of the medical-surgical vacuum system?
Which is true of instrument air sources?
options: They shal be permited to include at least two compressors
A standby header is not permitted
Can be capable of interconnection with medical air
They shall not produce air less than 200 psi pressure
answer: They shal be permited to include at least two compressors

question: Which of the following are permitted to be located in the same storage facility as medical gas supply systems?
options: Cylinders containing the same medical gas as their perspective central supply
Station outlet repair parts or cylinders containing medical gases
answer: Cylinders containing the same medical gas as their perspective central supply

question: Which of the following is a requirement for the protection of oxygen cylinders from damage?
options: Cylinder valves not painted or altered
Required to be stored away from elevators
answer: Cylinder valves not painted or altered

question: Which ASSE publication covers the design of medical gas systems?
Which NFPA code should you refer to for Life Safety?
In those portions of systems intended to handle oxygen at gauge pressures greater than _______psi, interconnecting hose shall contain no polymeric materials.
Medical air dryers shall be provided with a __________ downstream of each dryer for maintenance
Seals necessary for the operation of the valve and prevention of leaks  are __________?
The ______ valve shall be the line separating the applicability betweenNFPA 55and this code.
The auxiliary source connection shall be ________ and secured.
Fittings with internal seals shall be permitted where they meet all of the following requirements
options: Shall be cleaned for oxygen service  when used in patient gases or support gases
Shall be installed only where visible and accessible, allowing for testing and servicing

question: The system designer shall size the piping such that calculated pressure or vacuum losses across the piping as designed do not exceed ____ percent of the intended operating pressure or vacuum at the source valve.
New medical gas and vacuum pipeline distribution systems shall not be connected to the existing in-use systems until which installer preformed tests have been completed?
